&ltOBJECT>.INDEX_SETEXPLICIT() Syntax &ltOBJECT>.INDEX_SETEXPLICIT( Index_Name as C ) ArgumentDescription Index_NameThe tag name of an index.
Description The &ltOBJECT>.INDEX_SETEXPLICIT() method applies to:
Browses (for &ltOBJECT> use either the &ltBROWSE> pointer or the name of the browse)
Forms (for &ltOBJECT> use either the &ltFORM> pointer or the name of the form) The &ltOBJECT>.INDEX_SETEXPLICIT() method sets the primary index for the layout. It displays error message if Index_Name is not found. Limitations Desktop applications only. Example dim ptr as P ptr = form.load("Customer Information") ptr.Index_SetExplicit("Lastname1") ? ptr.Index_Name() = "Lastname1" ptr.Index_SetExplicit("Lastname2") ? ptr.Index_Name() = "Lastname2"
See Also Form Functions and Methods, Browse Functions and Methods
